Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate different habitats, such as playgrounds, gardens, forests, parking lots, ponds, streams, or lakes.
The student can draw various living things found in each habitat, including plants like trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can depict different animals found in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can compare the types of living things in different habitats through their drawings.
The student can identify patterns of biodiversity by showing the variety of plants and animals in each habitat.
